name: Tabacum
Relationship: Antidote: Vinegar; sour apples. CAMPHOR in the physiologicla antagonist. ARS. (chewing tobacco); IGN.; (smoking); SEP. (neuralgia and dyspepsia); LYCOP. (Impotency); NUX (bad taste due to tobacco); CALAD. AND PLAN TAG. (Cause aversion to tobacco); PHOSPH. (Tobacco heart, sexual weakness).Compare: HYDROBROMIC ACID; CAMPH.; VERAT.; ARS. Compare: NICOTINUM (Alternate tonic and clonic spasms, followed by general relaxation and trembling; nausea, cold sweat, and speedy collapse; head drawn back, contraction of eyelids and masseter muscles; muscles of neck and back rigid; hissing respiration from spasm of laryngeal and bronchial muscles).
Modalities: Worse: opening eyes; evening; extremes of heat and cold

Rectum: Diarrhoea, sudden, watery, with nausea and vomiting, prostration, and cold sweat; discharges look like sour milk, thick, curdled, watery
Heart: Pain radiates from center of sternum
Angina pectoris, pain in precordial region
Acute dilatation caused by shock or violent physical exertion
Palpitation when lying on left side
Eyes: Dim sight; sees as through a veil; strabismus
Rapid blindness without lesion, followed by venous hyperaemia and atrophy of optic nerve
Respiratory: Precordial oppression, with palpitation and pain between shoulders
Cough dry, teasing, must take a swallow of cold water  dyspnoea, with tingling down left arm when lying on left side
Stomach: Seasickness; terrible faint, sinking feeling at pit of stomach
Incessant nausea; worse, smell of tobacco smoke ; vomiting on least motion, sometimes of fecal matter
Sense of relaxation of stomach, with nausea
Gastralgia; pain from cardiac end extending to left arm
Head: Sudden pain, as if struck by a hammer
Tight feeling as from a band
Vertigo on opening eyes; sick headache, with deathly nausea; periodical
Nervous deafness
Secretion from eyes, nose and mouth increased
Urine: Renal colic; violent pain along ureter, left side
Abdomen: Wants abdomen uncovered, it lessens the nausea and vomiting
Face: Pale, blue, pinched, sunken, collapsed, covered with cold sweat
Sleep: Insomnia with dilated heart, with cold, clammy skin and anxiety
Throat: Nasopharyngitis and tracheitis, hemming, morning cough, sometimes with vomiting
Extremities: Legs and hands icy cold; limbs tremble

details: The symptomatology of Tabacum is exceedingly well marked. The nausea, giddiness, death-like pallor, vomiting, icy coldness, and sweat, with the intermittent pulse, are all most characteristic. Has marked antiseptic qualities, antidotal to cholera germs. Complete prostration of the entire muscular system. Collapse. Gastralgia, enteralgia, SEASICKNESS, cholera infantum; cold, but WANTS ABDOMEN UNCOVERED. Vigorous peristaltic activity. Diarrhoea. Produces high tension and arteriosclerosis of the coronary arteries. Should prove the most homeopathic drug for angina pectoris, with coronaritis and high tension (Cartier). Constriction of throat, chest, bladder, rectum. Pallor, breathlessness, hard cord like pulse.
dosage: Third to thirtieth and higher potencies.
